Class ModifyProductController

java.lang.Object
Controllers.ModifyProductController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ModifyProductController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller to modify a product

    • ModifyProductController

      public ModifyProductController()

  • Method Details

    • modifyProductSearch

      private void modifyProductSearch(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      This method dynamically searches for a part through the text box either by partial match of the name or match of the id. Will replace all entries with those that match the search criteria. Will display all entries if the text box is empty.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of the user typing either letter or number.

    • modifyProductAdd

      private void modifyProductAdd(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method allows for the part selected to be added into the list of parts associated with the product.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of the user clicking the button.

    • modifyProductRemove

      private void modifyProductRemove(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method deletes the part associated with the product. Will display a confirmation message to confirm the part being removed.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of the user clicking the button.

    • modifyProductSave

      private void modifyProductSave(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method allows for the product to be saved and will show a dialog box with a message that the part has been saved. Will return to the main form after the save is successful.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of the user clicking the button.
      Throws:
      IOException - The exception that can occur when creating a new scene.

    • modifyProductCancel

      private void modifyProductCancel(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method will cancel the adding process and will not save any of the entries made to the product. Will show a confirmation message to confirm cancellation
      Parameters:
      event - The event of the user clicking the button.
      Throws:
      IOException - The exception that can occur when creating a new scene.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the controller. Populates the entire parts inventory into the top table and associated parts into the bottom table.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url -
      resourceBundle -

    • popTables

      private void popTables()
      This method populates both the parts and product tables with each item in their respective inventory.

    • setVar

      private void setVar()
      This method sets the variables with the given entries of the part information to allow for easier saving.

    • validityTest

      private boolean validityTest()
      This method tests each text box to ensure that they are valid entries. If a text box fails, it calls on a method to show the relevant error. Initially a series of nested if statements changed into if else statements.
      Returns:
      Returns true if all text boxes are valid. False if there is any errors.

    • testInt

      private boolean testInt(String string)
      This method tests if the string is an integer.
      Parameters:
      string - The string to be tested.
      Returns:
      Either true or false based on the string tested.

    • testDouble

      private boolean testDouble(String string)
      This method tests if the string is double.
      Parameters:
      string - The string to be tested.
      Returns:
      Either true or false based on the string tested.

    • testMinMax

      private boolean testMinMax(boolean min, boolean max)
      This method tests if the minimum is greater than the max.
      Parameters:
      min - Boolean from testInt to ensure it is an integer when tested.
      max - Boolean from testInt to ensure it is an integer when tested.
      Returns:
      Returns true if max is greater than the minimum. Returns false if the minimum is greater than the max.

    • testInvMax

      private boolean testInvMax()
      This method tests to ensure the stock does not exceed the max.
      Returns:
      Returns true if the stock is not greater than or is equal to the max. Returns false if the stock is greater than the max.

    • errorBox

      private void errorBox(int i, javafx.scene.control.TextField tF)
      This method allows for the setup of different dialog boxes.
      Parameters:
      i - The number that relates to each separate dialog box.
      tF - The text field of the related error.
